intro: Senecio elodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring and summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. Senecio elodes is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
